ROBBERY.Definition: the crime of stealing from somewhere or someone

EQUIVALENT.Definition: having the same amount, value, purpose, qualities, etc.

THEFTS.Definition: (the act of) dishonestly taking something that belongs to someone else and keeping it

MISS A TRICK.Definition: missing out, not taking advantage of an opportunity or situation to gain some benefit for oneself

FANTASTIC.Definition: normally this means 'very good', but it can also be used to mean very unusual, strange, or unexpected

ROYAL MAIL.Definition: the postal service in the UK

CASH.Definition: money in the form of notes and coins, rather than cheques or credit cards

CIRCULATION.Definition: the process in which something such as information, money, or goods passes from one person to another

GRABBED.Definition: taken hold of something or someone suddenly and roughly

HARSH.Definition: unpleasant, unkind, cruel, or more severe than is necessary

TIED UP.Definition: to make a person unable to move by tying a rope or something similar around their body or part of their body

CARRIAGE.Definition: any of the separate parts of a train in which the passengers sit

DETACH.Definition: to separate or remove something from something else that it is connected to

TRACK.Definition: the pair of long metal bars fixed on the ground at an equal distance from each other, along which trains travel

ROUTINE.Definition: done as part of what usually happens, and not for any special reason

GANG.Definition: a group of criminals who work together

OVERPOWERED.Definition: to defeat someone by having greater strength or power

EMBANKMENT.Definition: an artificial slope made of earth and/or stones

ACCOMPLICES.Definition: a person who helps someone else to commit a crime or to do something morally wrong

FELLOW.Definition: used of people or a person with whom you share something, esp. the same kind of job, interest, or experience

GETAWAY.Definition: an occasion when someone leaves a place quickly, usually after committing a crime

SQUAD.Definition: a small group of people trained to work together as a unit

UNDERGROUND.Definition: below the surface of the earth; below ground, similar to 'underworld'

ASSOCIATES.Definition: people who are closely connected to another person as a companion, friend, or business partner

TIP-OFF.Definition: a secret warning or piece of secret information

ABNORMAL.Definition: different from what is usual or average, especially in a way that is bad

DESERTED.Definition: If a place is deserted, there are no people in it

BE ONTO SOMETHING.Definition: To be onto something or someone is to be aware of other information relating to the situation, esp. when someone is trying to deceive you

WIPE STH DOWN.Definition: to clean the surface of something, such as a table, with a cloth

FINGERPRINTS.Definition: the pattern of curved lines on the end of a finger or thumb that is different in every person, or a mark left by this pattern

CLUES.Definition: a sign or some information that helps you to find the answer to a problem, question, or mystery

CONSISTED.Definition: to be comprised of, made up of

MOTLEY CREW.Definition: a diverse and often poorly organised group

THREATEN.Definition: to tell someone that you will kill or hurt them or cause problems if they do not do what you want

MAN INSIDE.Definition: if you are a 'person inside', you have information about something that you could only get through being involved with that organisation

GET AWAY WITH SOMETHING.Definition: to succeed in doing, especially something bad

SENTENCE.Definition: to decide and say officially what a punishment will be

FLED.Definition: past simple and past participle of flee (to escape from)

PLASTIC SURGERY.Definition: a medical operation to bring a damaged area of skin, and sometimes bone, back to its usual appearance, or to improve a person's appearance

EXTRADITION.Definition: the act of making someone return for trial to another country or state where they have been accused of doing something illegal

TREATY.Definition: a written agreement between two or more countries, formally approved and signed by their leaders

DEPORT.Definition: to force someone to leave a country, especially someone who has no legal right to be there or who has broken the law

TRIED.Definition: past of 'try' to examine a person accused of committing a crime in a law court by asking them questions and considering known facts, and then decide if they are guilty

CAIPIRINHAS.Definition: a Brazilian alcoholic drink made with Brazilian rum, lime juice, sugar, and ice

SERVE.Definition: to spend a period of time in a job or activity

COMPASSIONATE.Definition: showing compassion (a strong feeling of sympathy and sadness for the suffering or bad luck of others and a wish to help them)

ROMANTICISED.Definition: to talk about something in a way that makes it sound better than it really is, or to believe that something is better than it really is

VICTIM.Definition: someone or something that has been hurt, damaged, or killed or has suffered, either because of the actions of someone or something else, or because of illness or chance

IRON BAR.Definition: a large piece of hard metal

SEVERE.Definition: causing very great pain, difficulty, worry, damage, etc.; very serious

VICTIMLESS.Definition: In a victimless crime no one suffers directly, sometimes because the people affected by the crime have agreed to take part in it

THEFT.Definition: (the act of) dishonestly taking something that belongs to someone else and keeping it

ECLIPSED.Definition: become more successful or important than something else

POP CULTURE.Definition: music, TV, cinema, books, etc. that are popular and enjoyed by ordinary people, rather than experts or very educated people

MANHUNT.Definition: an organised search for a person, especially a criminal

INSPIRE.Definition: to make someone feel that they want to do something and can do it
